snippet: The Liberal Democrats, the coalition’s junior partner, withheld support from Prime Minister David Cameron’s handling of events concerning News Corporation’s BSkyB bid.
abstract: Britain’s coalition government comes under renewed strain after its junior partner, the Liberal Democrats, withhold parliamentary backing for Prime Minister David Cameron’s handling of events flowing from a failed bid by Rupert Murdoch’s News Corporation to take full control of BSkyB; development came as the leader of the Liberal Democrats, Deputy Prime Minister Nick Clegg, testified at a judicial inquiry into the behavior, ethics and culture of the British press.

byline.original: By JOHN F. BURNS and ALAN COWELL

lead_paragraph: The Liberal Democrats, the coalition’s junior partner, withheld support from Prime Minister David Cameron’s handling of events concerning News Corporation’s BSkyB bid.

headline.seo: Press Inquiry Strains Britain’s Coalition Government
headline.main: Press Inquiry Strains Britain’s Coalition Government
headline.print_headline: Press Inquiry Strains Britain’s Coalition Government
